com.camerontec.catalys.util.stats

Interface IAccumulator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IConfigurable, IRegisterable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Accumulator, AggregatingStatisticalAccumulator, BaseAccumulator, EmbeddedAdapterOutboundLatencyBenchmark, EmbeddedAdapterStatelessRouterBenchmark, HistogramAccumulator, StoringStatisticalAccumulator

    public interface IAccumulator
extends IConfigurable
    Describes an object that can keep a record of long value data.

    Note that the object does not necessarily need to permanently store all data passed to it. It may, for example, just accumulate summary statistics on the data.

    Note that IAccumulator objects should have a constructor which takes a Properties object.

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears out all recorded data.

      • accumulate

        void accumulate(long id,
                long val)
        Accumulates the given data point (id and value).

        This should be very fast and create no objects, so that it has minimal performance impact.

        Parameters:
        id - ID, if any, associated with the value. Just pass 0 or some other special value if there is no id.
        val - Value to be accumulated.

      • getNumIgnoredAtStartup

        int getNumIgnoredAtStartup()
        Returns number of values to ignore at start up. Configuration property.
        Returns:
        Number of values to ignore before starting to process them. Defaults to 0.
        See Also:
        setNumIgnoredAtStartup(int)

      • setNumIgnoredAtStartup

        void setNumIgnoredAtStartup(int numIgnoredAtStartup)
        Instructs the accumulator to ignore the first few values. Configuration property.

        Sometimes the first few values will be non typical and should be ignored.

        Parameters:
        numIgnoredAtStartup - Number of values to ignore before starting to process them. Defaults to 0.

      • setSampleSize

        void setSampleSize(int value)
        After this many accumulated data points, the accumulator will display the data to standard output and reset the statistics. Configuration property.
        Parameters:
        value - Number of data points before dumping stats and clearing.

      • getSampleSize

        int getSampleSize()
        After this many accumulated data points, the accumulator will display the data to standard output and reset the statistics Configuration property.
        Returns:
        the number of samples per dump
        See Also:
        setNumIgnoredAtStartup(int)
